open_spaces_details.description: The site is located within Syon Park and has been purposely chosen to ensure that the marquee will have minimal visual impact on the landscape. The site is screened on three sides from Syon House and Park by a mature yew hedge and on the fourth side by mature trees, with further screening from the Park by a large brick wall. No excavation will take place during the installation of the marquee and no trees or planting will be removed. As soon as the marquee is dismantled the area will be reinstated to grassland.

description: Erection of a temporary marquee for 10 years for daytime and evening private/corporate events from 1 May 2024 to 30 September 2033
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The permission hereby granted shall be for a limited period of ten years for the erection of the marquee from 1st May to 30th September for each consecutive year and the permission shall expire on 30th September 2033 when the use shall cease and the marquee removed within one week of that date. The site of the marquee shall be made good, levelled and laid to grass no later than one month after its removal for each yearly period.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Marquee Site, Syon Park ? Location Plan 01; Marquee Site, Syon Park ? Site Plan 02; Planning, Design and Access Statement dated October 2022 and unnumbered 1:5000 site plan. Received: 20
December 2022. Heritage Impact Assessment dated 23 May 2023. Received: 24 May 2023. A-02; A-01; A-03; Options Appraisal dated 27 November 2023. Received: 27 November 2023.]

Condition : 3 - No development (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall take place until full details and samples of all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the marquee hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Details must include physical sample of the panel material for the walls and roof of the marquee in the colour to be used.
Condition : 4 - No excavations shall take place for the construction of, or for the purposes of the use of the marquee.

Condition : 5 - No more than 50 events shall take place per season unless agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. A list of events that have taken place shall be permanently recorded and provided to the Local planning Authority at their request.
Condition : 6 - The use hereby permitted for marquee event purposes shall not be carried out outside of the following times: 10am to 12 midnight Monday to Saturdays and 10am to 11pm on Sundays.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until a car park management scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This will include details of measures to ensure that visitors or staff cars associated with the use are parked in no place other than the main public car park or in the Lime Avenue car parking area (using the latter only in the event that the
main public car park is already full) or the designated disabled persons? parking spaces shown on the plans hereby approved and shall ensure that these car parking areas are shown in the submitted application are available exclusively to visitors and staff at the event.

Condition : 8 - A visitor welcome pack shall be provided to all event organisers and visitors outlining various public transport options available in the local area to encourage visitors to use sustainable travel.

Condition : 9 - Prior to the first use of the hereby approved development a delivery and servicing management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall include measures for the recycling of waste on site. The plan shall be implemented as approved.
Condition : 10 - No Fireworks displays shall take place in conjunction with any event held in or adjoining the Marquee hereby approved.

Condition : 11 - Before the marquee is first used, each year, a sound limiter (environmental noise control system) shall be installed in the marquee in accordance with details that shall be first submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to control noise levels. The sound system (or at least the power amplifier(s)) are to be permanently installed at the venue, maintained in an operational state and kept switched on at all times when amplification is used and no sound checks are to be carried out outside the permitted hours of use.

Condition : 12 - For the duration of any event to be held in the marquee, the organisers shall take measures to ensure that visitors and staff do not enter the adjacent area of nearby Site of Special Scientific Interest.

Condition : 13 - Accessibility to the marquee for wheelchair users, including provisions for disabled parking spaces, shall be provided in accordance with the specifications noted in the design and access statement and shall be maintained whilst the marquee is in use.
Condition : 14 - No additional structures associated with the marquee use shall be erected on site other than those approved within.
